Content: A shared short Wakeup Word database focusing on perceived emotion in speech The dataset contains 488 Wakeup Word speech
Emotions: angry, happy, sad, neutral
Paper: `Hi, KIA: A Speech Emotion Recognition Dataset for Wake-Up Words <https://arxiv.org/abs/2211.03371>`_

Content: 6902 labeled samples acted out by 431 amateur actors while verbalizing 18 different sentences
Emotions: anger, disgust, fear, joy, sadness, surprise, neutral

Content: 468 audio samples, six different sentences, pronounced by thirteen people (four male and nine female), in five basic emotions plus one neutral emotion
Emotions: Anger, Sadness, Surprise, Happiness, Fear, Neutral

Content: Ten sentences from eight actors, equally divided between genders, and they were free to choose the phrases for record audios in four emotions (377 audios).
Emotions: happiness, anger, sadness or neutral

Content: Spanish peruvian speech gathered from Spanish interviews, TV reports, political debate and testimonials. It contains 3749 utterances, 80 speakers (44 male and 36 female), created from Youtube audios
Emotions: Valence, Arousal and Dominance

Content: 7000 sentence-level utterances of the Bangla language, 20 professional actors (10 males and 10 females), recordings, 10 sentences for 7 target emotions.
Emotions: Anger, Disgust, Fear, Happiness, Neutral, Sadness and Surprise
Paper: `SUST Bangla Emotional Speech Corpus (SUBESCO): An audio-only emotional speech corpus for Bangla <https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pone.0250173>`_

Content: Audio Speech Sentiment Dataset
Emotions: 4 emotions provides audio recordings of spoken sentences for anger, happiness, sadness, and neutral emotions.

Content: 12420 audio recordings (~15 hours) and their transcriptions by 7 native speakers.
Emotions: Emotional labels using dimensions: valence, arousal, and dominance.
Paper: `A speech corpus of Quechua Collao for automatic dimensional emotion recognition <https://www.nature.com/articles/s41597-022-01855-9>`_

Content: 864 audio files of single-word emotional utterances with Mexican cultural shaping.
Emotions: 6 emotions provides single-word utterances for anger, disgust, fear, happiness, neutral, and sadness.
Paper: `The Mexican Emotional Speech Database (MESD): elaboration and assessment based on machine learning <https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/34891601/>`_

Content: Synthesized database of three basic emotions and neutral expression based on rule-based manipulation for a diphone synthesizer which we release to the public
Emotions: 997 utterances including 6 emotions: angry, bored, happy, neutral, sad and scared
Paper: `SyntAct: A Synthesized Database of Basic Emotions <http://felix.syntheticspeech.de/publications/synthetic_database.pdf>`_

Content: LSSED: A Large-Scale Dataset and Benchmark for Speech Emotion Recognition
Emotions: Anger, happiness, sadness, disappointment, boredom, disgust, excitement, fear, surprise, normal, and other.
Paper: `LSSED: A Large-Scale Spanish Emotional Speech Database for Speech Processing and Machine Learning <https://arxiv.org/abs/2102.01754>`_

Content: ~32700 audio recordings files produced by 154 speakers. Each audio recording corresponds to one English numeral (from "zero" to "billion")
Emotions: Intonations: neutral, bored, excited and question

Content: ~13285 audio files collected from movies, tv shows and youtube containing speech and non-speech.
Emotions: 12 different natural emotions (boredom, neutral, happiness, sadness, anger, fear, surprise, disgust, excitement, pleasure, pain, disappointment) with 2 levels of intensity.
Language: Chinese, English, French, Russian and others

Content: 29 hours, 3500 sentences, by 10 native English speakers and 10 native Chinese speakers.
Emotions: 5 emotions: angry, happy, neutral, sad, and surprise.
Paper: `Seen And Unseen Emotional Style Transfer For Voice Conversion With A New Emotional Speech Dataset <https://arxiv.org/pdf/2010.14794.pdf>`_

Content: 40 hours, 6,000+ recordings of 25,000+ sentences by 70+ English speakers (see db link for details).
Emotions: continuous emotion dimensions characterized using valence, arousal, and trustworthiness.
Paper: `The Multimodal Sentiment Analysis in Car Reviews (MuSe-CaR) Dataset: Collection, Insights and Improvements <https://arxiv.org/pdf/2101.06053.pdf>`_

Content: The recordings are 41 hours, 36 minutes long (27,854 utterances), and were performed by 200 professional actors (112 female, 88 male).
Emotions: 5 main emotions assigned to actors: Neutral, Anger, Happiness, Sadness, and Frustration.

Content: 79 utterances with 10 to 13 utterances pro emotion by 32 non-professional speakers.
Emotions: 7 emotions: sadness, anger, disgust, fear, surprise, joy, neutral.

Content: 25 speakers interpreting 100 utterances in 4 social attitudes, with 3-5 repetitions each per attitude for a total of around 30 hours of speech.
Emotions: expressive speech in French, 100 phrases with multiple versions (3 to 5) in four social attitudes (friendly, distant, dominant and seductive).
Paper: `Att-HACK: An Expressive Speech Database with Social Attitudes <https://arxiv.org/abs/2004.04410>`_

Content: 100 hours by over 100 speakers (see db link for details).
Emotions: This corpus is annotated with emotional labels using attribute-based descriptors (activation, dominance and valence) and categorical labels (anger, happiness, sadness, disgust, surprised, fear, contempt, neutral and other).
Paper: `The MSP-Conversation Corpus <http://www.interspeech2020.org/index.php?m=content&c=index&a=show&catid=290&id=684>`_

Content: Bangla Emotional Audio-Speech Corpus
Emotions: 6 emotions provides Bangla spoken utterances for anger, happiness, sadness, fear, surprise, and neutral.
Paper: `BEASC: Bangla Emotional Audio-Speech Corpus - A Speech Emotion Recognition Corpus for the Low-Resource Bangla Language <https://easy.dans.knaw.nl/ui/datasets/id/easy-dataset:236649>`_

Content: Recordings and their associated transcriptions by a diverse group of speakers.
Emotions: 4 emotions: general, joy, anger, and sadness.

Content: 400 utterances by 38 speakers (27 male and 11 female).
Emotions: 4 emotions: angry, happy, neutral, and sad.
Paper: `Cross Lingual Speech Emotion Recognition: Urdu vs. Western Languages <https://arxiv.org/pdf/1812.10411.pdf>`_

Content: 1935 recording by 61 speakers (45 male and 16 female).
Emotions: 3 levels of emotion.

Content: non-speech, 1085 audio file by 11 speakers.
Emotions: non-speech 6 emotions: achievement, anger, fear, pain, pleasure, and surprise with 3 emotional intensities (low, moderate, strong, peak).
Paper: `The Variably Intense Vocalizations of Affect and Emotion (VIVAE) corpus prompts new perspective on nonspeech perception <http://dx.doi.org/10.1037/emo0001048>`_

Content: Dataset containing emotion annotations of 794 songs as well as the simultaneous electrodermal activity (EDA) signals. A Music Emotion Experiment was well-designed for collecting the affective-annotated music corpus of high quality, which recruited 457 subjects.
Emotions: Valence, Arousal
Paper: `The PMEmo Dataset for Music Emotion Recognition <https://dl.acm.org/doi/10.1145/3206025.3206037>`_

Content: more than 2000 minutes of audio-visual data of 398 people (201 male and 197 female) coming from 6 cultures.
Emotions: emotions are characterized using valence and arousal.
Language: Chinese, English, German, Greek, Hungarian and Serbian
Paper: `SEWA DB: A Rich Database for Audio-Visual Emotion and Sentiment Research in the Wild <https://arxiv.org/pdf/1901.02839.pdf>`_

Content: 1400 dialogues and 14000 utterances from Friends TV series  by multiple speakers.
Emotions: 7 emotions: Anger, disgust, sadness, joy, neutral, surprise and fear.  MELD also has sentiment (positive, negative and neutral) annotation  for each utterance.
Paper: `MELD: A Multimodal Multi-Party Dataset for Emotion Recognition in Conversations <https://arxiv.org/pdf/1810.02508.pdf>`_

Content: 3000 semi-natural utterances, equivalent to 3 hours and 25 minutes of speech data from online radio plays by 87 native-Persian speakers.
Emotions: 6 emotions: anger, fear, happiness, sadness, neutral and surprise.
Paper: `ShEMO: a large-scale validated database for Persian speech emotion detection <https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s10579-018-9427-x>`_

Content: 9365 emotional and 332 neutral samples produced by 68 native speakers (23 females, 45 males).
Emotions: 7/6 emotions: anger, sadness, happiness, fear, surprise, disgust, and the secondary emotion guilt.
Paper: `DEMoS: An Italian emotional speech corpus. Elicitation methods, machine learning, and perception <https://link.springer.com/epdf/10.1007/s10579-019-09450-y?author_access_token=5pf0w_D4k9z28TM6n4PbVPe4RwlQNchNByi7wbcMAY5hiA-aXzXNbZYfsMDDq2CdHD-w5ArAxIwlsk2nC_26pSyEAcu1xlKJ1c9m3JZj2ZlFmlVoCZUTcG3Hq2_2ozMLo3Hq3Y0CHzLdTxihQwch5Q%3D%3D>`_

Content: around 500 utterances by a diverse group of actors (over 5 actors) siumlating various emotions.
Emotions: 5 emotions: anger, disgust, fear, happiness, and sadness.
Paper: `Speech Emotion Recognition for Performance Interaction <https://www.researchgate.net/publication/326005164_Speech_Emotion_Recognition_for_Performance_Interaction>`_

Content: Recordings for 4 speakers- 2 males and 2 females.
Emotions: The emotional styles are neutral, sleepiness, anger, disgust and amused.
Paper: `The emotional voices database: Towards controlling the emotion dimension in voice generation systems <https://arxiv.org/pdf/1806.09514.pdf>`_

Content: 7356 recordings by 24 actors.
Emotions: 7 emotions: calm, happy, sad, angry, fearful, surprise, and disgust
Paper: `The Ryerson Audio-Visual Database of Emotional Speech and Song (RAVDESS): A dynamic, multimodal set of facial and vocal expressions in North American English <https://journals.plos.org/plosone/article?id=10.1371/journal.pone.0196391>`_

Content: 2400 recording of 240 sentences by 4 actors (2 males and 2 females).
Emotions: 5 primary emotions: angry, sad, neutral, happy, excited. 5 secondary emotions: anxious, apologetic, pensive, worried, enthusiastic.
Paper: `An Open Source Emotional Speech Corpus for Human Robot Interaction Applications <https://www.isca-speech.org/archive/Interspeech_2018/pdfs/1349.pdf>`_

Content: 6 different sentences by 12 speakers (6 fmelaes + 6 males).
Emotions: 7 emotions: happy, sad, angry, fearful, surprise, disgust and neutral. Each emotion is acted in 2 different intensities.

Content: 1115 audio instances sentences extracted from various films.
Emotions: 5 emotions: anger, contempt, happiness, fear, and sadness.
Paper: `Categorical vs Dimensional Perception of Italian Emotional Speech <https://pdfs.semanticscholar.org/e70e/fcf7f5b4c366a7b7e2c16267d7f7691a5391.pdf>`_

Content: 1384 recording by multiple speakers.
Emotions: 3 emotions: angry, happy, surprised.
Paper: `Arabic Natural Audio Dataset <https://data.mendeley.com/datasets/xm232yxf7t/1>`_

Content: 144 audio file labelled by 40 listeners.
Emotions: Emotion (no speech) defined in regard of valence and arousal.
Paper: `The Perceived Emotion of Isolated Synthetic Audio: The EmoSynth Dataset and Results <https://dl.acm.org/doi/10.1145/3243274.3243277>`_

Content: 65 hours of annotated video from more than 1000 speakers and 250 topics.
Emotions: 6 Emotion (happiness, sadness, anger,fear, disgust, surprise) + Likert scale.
Paper: `Multi-attention Recurrent Network for Human Communication Comprehension <https://arxiv.org/pdf/1802.00923.pdf>`_

Content: 14 different phrases by 12 speakers (6 female + 6 male) for a total of 1167 recordings.
Emotions: 7 emotions: Happiness, Disgust, Fear, Neutral, Anger, Surprise, Sadness
Paper: `VERBO: Voice Emotion Recognition dataBase in Portuguese Language <https://thescipub.com/pdf/jcssp.2018.1420.1430.pdf>`_

Content: 2199 opinion utterances with annotated sentiment.
Emotions: Sentiment annotated between very negative to very positive in seven Likert steps.
Paper: `Multi-attention Recurrent Network for Human Communication Comprehension <https://arxiv.org/pdf/1802.00923.pdf>`_

Content: 20 sentences by 12 actors.
Emotions: 4 emotions: angry, sad, happy, neutral, other, without agreement
Paper: `MSP-IMPROV: An Acted Corpus of Dyadic Interactions to Study Emotion Perception <https://ecs.utdallas.edu/research/researchlabs/msp-lab/publications/Busso_2017.pdf>`_

Content: 7442 clip of 12 sentences spoken by 91 actors (48 males and 43 females).
Emotions: 6 emotions: angry, disgusted, fearful, happy, neutral, and sad
Paper: `CREMA-D: Crowd-sourced Emotional Multimodal Actors Dataset <https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4313618/>`_

Dataset: `Example emotion videos used in investigation of emotion perception in schizophrenia <https://espace.library.uq.edu.au/view/UQ:446541>`_
Content: 6 videos:Two example videos from each emotion category (angry, happy and neutral) by one female speaker.
Emotions: 3 emotions: angry, happy and neutral.

Content: 6 actors  who  played  14  sentences.
Emotions: 6 emotions: disgust, fear, anger, joy, surprise, sadness.
Paper: `EMOVO Corpus: an Italian Emotional Speech Database <https://core.ac.uk/download/pdf/53857389.pdf>`_

Content: 3.8 hours of recordings by 46 participants.
Emotions: negative and positive sentiment (valence and arousal).
Paper: `Introducing the RECOLA Multimodal Corpus of Remote Collaborative and Affective Interactions <https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B2V_I9XKBODhNENKUnZWNFdVXzQ/view>`_

Content: Videos10 actors portraying 10 states.
Emotions: 12 emotions: amusement, anxiety, cold anger (irritation), despair, hot anger (rage),  fear (panic), interest, joy (elation), pleasure(sensory), pride, relief, and sadness. Plus, 5 additional emotions: admiration, contempt, disgust, surprise, and tenderness.
Paper: `Introducing the Geneva Multimodal Expression Corpus for Experimental Research on Emotion Perception <https://www.researchgate.net/publication/51796867_Introducing_the_Geneva_Multimodal_Expression_Corpus_for_Experimental_Research_on_Emotion_Perception>`_

Content: 9114 spontaneous utterances and 2656 acted utterances by 4 professional actors (two male and two female).
Emotions: 9 emotional states: fear, surprise, sadness, disgust, anger, anticipation, joy, acceptance and the neutral state.
Paper: `Naturalistic emotional speech collectionparadigm with online game and its psychological and acoustical assessment <https://www.jstage.jst.go.jp/article/ast/33/6/33_E1175/_pdf>`_

Content: 347 dialogs with 9,083 system-user exchanges.
Emotions: Emotions classified as garbage, non-angry, slightly angry and very angry.
Paper: `A Parameterized and Annotated Spoken Dialog Corpus of the CMU Let’s Go Bus Information System <http://www.lrec-conf.org/proceedings/lrec2012/pdf/333_Paper.pdf>`_
License: License available with the data. Free of charges for research purposes only.

Content: 95 dyadic conversations from 21 subjects. Each subject converses with another playing one of four characters with emotions.
Emotions: 5 FeelTrace annotations: activation, valence, dominance, power, intensity
Paper: `The SEMAINE Database: Annotated Multimodal Records of Emotionally Colored Conversations between a Person and a Limited Agent <https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/5959155>`_

Content: 480 British English utterances by 4 males actors.
Emotions: 7 emotions: anger, disgust, fear, happiness, sadness, surprise and neutral.
Paper: `Multimodal Emotion Recognition <http://personal.ee.surrey.ac.uk/Personal/P.Jackson/pub/ma10/HaqJackson_MachineAudition10_approved.pdf>`_
License: Free of charges for research purposes only.

Content: 2800 recording by 2 actresses.
Emotions: 7 emotions: anger, disgust, fear, happiness, pleasant surprise, sadness, and neutral.
Paper: `BEHAVIOURAL FINDINGS FROM THE TORONTO EMOTIONAL SPEECH SET <https://www.semanticscholar.org/paper/BEHAVIOURAL-FINDINGS-FROM-THE-TORONTO-EMOTIONAL-SET-Dupuis-Pichora-Fuller/d7f746b3aee801a353b6929a65d9a34a68e71c6f/figure/2>`_

Content: 26 text passage read by 10 speakers.
Emotions: 4 main emotions: joy, sadness, anger and neutral.
Paper: `Estonian Emotional Speech Corpus <https://www.researchgate.net/publication/261724574_Estonian_Emotional_Speech_Corpus_Release_1>`_

Content: 12 hours of audiovisual data by 10 actors in 5 sessions.
Emotions: Full: neutral state; happiness; sadness; anger; surprise; fear; disgust; frustration; excited; other. Balance 5 emotions: happiness, anger, sadness, frustration and neutral. Three dimensions: valence, arousal, dominance
Paper: `IEMOCAP: Interactive emotional dyadic motion capture database <https://sail.usc.edu/iemocap/Busso_2008_iemocap.pdf>`_

Content: A set of human speech with vocal emotion spoken by a Japanese male speaker.
Emotions: 47 emotions including angry, joyful, disgusting, downgrading, funny,  worried, gentle, relief, indignation, shameful, etc.
Paper: `EMOTIONAL SPEECH SYNTHESIS USING SUBSPACE CONSTRAINTS IN PROSODY <http://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/download?doi=10.1.1.420.8899&rep=rep1&type=pdf>`_

Content: 800 recording spoken by 10 actors (5 males and 5 females).
Emotions: 7 emotions: anger, neutral, fear, boredom, happiness, sadness, disgust.
Paper: `A Database of German Emotional Speech <http://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/download?doi=10.1.1.130.8506&rep=rep1&type=pdf>`_

Content: Videos by 42 subjects, coming from 14 different nationalities.
Emotions: 6 emotions: anger, fear, surprise, happiness, sadness and disgust.
License: Free of charges for research purposes only.

Content: 4 speakers (2 males and 2 females).
Emotions: 5 emotions: neutral,  surprise,  happiness,  sadness  and  anger
Paper: `Documentation of the Danish Emotional Speech Database <http://kom.aau.dk/~tb/speech/Emotions/des.pdf>`_
